means: 损毁…的外形，使变丑( disfigure的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He has been left hideously disfigured by plastic surgery.
sentence.Network_cn: 整形外科手术导致他完全毁容了。

sentence.Network_en: She tried not to look at the scarred, disfigured face.
sentence.Network_cn: 她尽量不去看那张带有疤痕的丑陋脸庞。

sentence.Network_en: Two dogs attacked him, leaving him horribly disfigured.
sentence.Network_cn: 两条狗袭击了他，导致他面容全毁。

PerfectNetExp.abs: Her face was disfigured by a broken nose ., 她的脸因鼻子残损而破相.
children preferred images of disfigured or disabled peers to image of fat kids ., 孩子们就宁肯喜欢那些外形有缺陷和有残疾的同龄人 , 也不喜欢胖小孩的形象.

list.abs: at last some common disfigurements in fine-blanking work pieces were summarized , and some resolvent to them .最后总结了精冲中常见的质量缺陷，以及解决的方法。
physical disability 残疾physical disfigurement 身体变形physical education 体育
3.37果面缺陷 Fruit disfigurement人为或自然因素对果实表皮造成的损伤。.
scar formation was avoided , and disfiguring pigmentation in the paravenous connective tissue was hardly ever observed .并且避免了疤痕的形成，而且几乎没有观察到结缔组织有色素沉着。

entry.def: If someone is disfigured, their appearance is spoiled.

example.ex: Many of the wounded had been badly disfigured.
example.tran: 很多伤者面容严重受损。

entry.tran: 破坏…的外形;毁损…的外观
entry.def: To disfigure an object or a place means to spoil its appearance.

example.ex: Wind turbines are large and noisy and they disfigure the landscape.
example.tran: 风力涡轮机个头大、噪音响，还会破坏周边风景。

auth_sentence.content: Their faces are often disfigured, the skulls crushed.

auth_sentence.content: Rather an ugly baby, disfigured by a hare lip.
